Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 5th overall pick, by Capital City in 1982...
Had first career hit (homerun) on 4/29/1982, off Jack Kendall (PIL)...
Drove in 7 runs against Lynchburg on 7/8/1983...
Drove in 6 runs against Diablo on 6/4/1984...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1984, hitting .360 with 8 HR, 18 RBI...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Pontiac on 7/27/1985...
Traded from Capital City to New Jersey on 7/30/1985 (Going to CC: P B. Clatterbuck. Going to NJ: CF J. Baugh)...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1985, hitting .478 with 4 HR, 6 RBI...
Traded from New Jersey to Bay City on 7/23/1986 (Going to BC: CF J. Baugh. Going to NJ: 3B B. Thompson, P J. Diez, 3B D. Gardner)...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 8/8/1987...
Signed as a free agent by Coney Island on 2/11/1988 to a 4-year deal worth $11,111,111 per year...
Injured on 6/1/1988 with a Bruised Heel, out for one week...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Penn on 5/17/1989...
Injured on 8/6/1989 with a Strained Hamstring Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Northeastern on 5/22/1990...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
